wireframe

Interface Groupable

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractWireframeElement, ComboBox, Group, Header, Image, ListElement, Paragraph, ProgressBar, RoundedBox, ScrollBar, Slider, Text

    public interface Groupable
    A Groupable consists of something on a Wireframe that can be grouped together. In addition to grouping and ungrouping operations, the related operations of locking / unlocking are also tied to the Groupable interface.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.Optional<Group> getParentGroup()
      Returns the parent group of this Groupable.
      void groupDelete()
      Specifies the deletion behavior to do when this Groupable's group is deleted.
      boolean isLocked()
      Returns whether this Groupable is locked or not.
      void lock()
      Lock this element.
      void moveGroup(int xOffset, int yOffset)
      Specifies the movement behavior to do when this Groupable's group moves to a new location using given offset.
      void setParentGroup(java.util.Optional<Group> parentGroup)
      Sets the parent group of this Groupable to the specified parent group.
      void unlock()
      Unlock this element.

    • Method Detail

      • lock

        void lock()
        Lock this element. When a Groupable is locked, it cannot be modified in any way, with few exceptions.

      • unlock

        void unlock()
        Unlock this element. When a Groupable is locked, it cannot be modified in any way, with few exceptions.

      • isLocked

        boolean isLocked()
        Returns whether this Groupable is locked or not.
        Returns:
        true if this Groupable is locked, false if it is unlocked

      • setParentGroup

        void setParentGroup(java.util.Optional<Group> parentGroup)
             throws LockedException
        Sets the parent group of this Groupable to the specified parent group. If a Groupable has a parent group, then it is an element of its parent group's member list.
        Parameters:
        parentGroup - the Optional containing the parent group of this element
        Throws:
        LockedException - if this Groupable is locked and cannot be modified

      • getParentGroup

        java.util.Optional<Group> getParentGroup()
        Returns the parent group of this Groupable. If a Groupable has a parent group, then it is an element of its parent group's member list.
        Returns:
        the parentGroup of this Groupable, enclosed in an Optional.

      • moveGroup

        void moveGroup(int xOffset,
               int yOffset)
        throws LockedException
        Specifies the movement behavior to do when this Groupable's group moves to a new location using given offset.
        Parameters:
        xOffset - the x offset to move this Groupable to (in pixels)
        yOffset - the y offset to move this Groupable to (in pixels)
        Throws:
        LockedException - if this Groupable is locked or its parent Group is locked

      • groupDelete

        void groupDelete()
          throws LockedException
        Specifies the deletion behavior to do when this Groupable's group is deleted.
        Throws:
        LockedException - if this Groupable cannot be deleted due to a lock
